                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        LanguageKuninjku, Kunwinjku

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Shovel spear type with a long stone blade for the head. These may be the predecessors of the famous ‘shovel-nosed’ spears of Arnhem Land which have heads made of iron or other metal originally obtained from the Macassans. The stone blade is attached to the shaft via a socket made of fibre string ironwood resin and beeswax.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Manu manbirrmurlu makka kunwardde birridongi nawu dabborrabbolk birrimarnbuni manmirrhmak wanjh birridjarlkkenami kore mankole bu birriyami kunj.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          To make ‘manbirrmurlu’ type spears, people used to strike stones to make sharp stone flakes, then attach them to spear shafts in order to hunt kangaroos.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          (Jill Njanjmirra)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        LanguageKuninjku,Kunwinjku

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Spring water, clear water.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Bu korroko dabborrabbolk birringadkarungi birribongalkeyi kanjdji kore kurorre, wanjh birrinani bu manboburlerri wanjh kunngobarn birrimangi birridjuhkeyi wanjh bobelemeninj bu manbobele wanjh ngarribonguni.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          In the old days when our ancestors used to dig wells to find water under the ground, if they saw that the water was dirty then they would gather some pandanus leaves and put them into the water. Then the water would become clear (the dirt would sink to the bottom) and we could drink the clear water.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          (Jill Nganjmirra)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Path, track, road.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Bininj manbolh.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Traditional walking route.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Manbu… manbolh wam kore Pine Creek, wanjh borledmi Darwin way. Kunih yimowoni manbolh kerrngehkenh bu.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          That road… went to Pine Creek then turned up towards Darwin. That’s where it used to go, that road.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          (Quoted in Etherington, Steve, ‘Learning to be Kunwinjku: Kunwinjku people discuss their pedagogy’, PhD Thesis, Charles Darwin University, 2006)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Stringybark.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Scientific nameEucalyptus tetrodonta

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Bu karrire karrilobme mandengeyi kore manberrk dja kore manbolh, wanjh karrinan manbordokorr dulkdoweng dja dolobbo birrilowkmey.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          When we drive in bushland or along the road, we see stringybark trees that have died because people have stripped the bark off (to make bark paintings etc).

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          (Andrew Manakgu, Injalak Arts painting documentation.)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        LanguageKuninjku= manburludak

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Banyan fig tree.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Manbu mandjabu korroko dabborrabbolk birrimangi kunyarl kore manbornde mandedjmad kunyarl dja kore kundulk manbudbud kunyarl.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          In the old days, people used banyan root fibres and kurrajong bark fibres to make string for fish traps.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          (Andrew Manakgu, Injalak Arts painting documentation.)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Fresh water.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Ngalbu kuluybirr ngalka kadi kare kore kukku manbowinjku kore mandem karri kunbak dja mandjimdjim kadulkdjuhmiyindi.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          The saratoga lives in fresh water, where there are water lilies and water weeds and where the water pandanus stands in the water.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          (Andrew Manakgu, Injalak Arts painting documentation)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Warradjan ngalkka ngalengman kadjalyo kare kore kubowinjku kukku minj kare kore kurrula.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          The pig-nosed turtle only lives in the fresh water, it doesn’t go into the ocean.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          (Andrew Manakgu, Injalak Arts painting documentation)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        -kubowinjku

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          In fresh water.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        1Landscape with swales (water-catching depressions), typically a string of small seasonal billabongs and alluvial watercourse margins.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Nawu Korlobarr nakka kani kore manberrk dja kore manbowk manlabbarl.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          The antilopine kangaroo lives in open forest, as well as swampy areas around billabongs.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        2Country with numerous wallow holes caused by buffaloes or feral pigs.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          -manbohbobowk

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Expansive seasonal swamp area. A retriplicated form of manbowk.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          A small white apple tree.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Scientific nameSyzygium forte sp.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Yawkyawk birriwam manboyberre.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            The girls went looking for white apple fruits.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            (Maralngurra, Dolly, ‘Reader 36’, Oenpelli Literature Production Centre, 1981)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          LanguageKunwinjku, Kundjeyhmi, Kundedjnjenghmi

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Which, who, that.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Muddika manbu mankukkurlba.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            A red car (literally 'a car which is red').

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            (Jill Nganjmirra)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Manwern manbu manme ngarriburrbun manwern manme manbu minj ngarrikukngun yiman karrbarda mankinjdjek mankodjbang manbuled mankongkong dja manwern manbu minj ngarrikukngun. Manwern manme ngarriwilkdeng. Badjdjo dja mankurladj makka ngarrikukngun.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            There are lots of (bush) vegetables that we know. There are lots of vegetables which we don’t eat raw, like long yams, cheeky yams, water peanuts, Triglochin dubia and bush potatoes. There are lot of vegetables that we cook in hot coals. Brachystelma glabriflorum and spike rush corms are two vegetable foods which we eat raw.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            (Andrew Manakgu, Injalak Arts painting documentation)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          GrammarRelates to 'man-' class nouns. For 'ngal-' class nouns ngalbu is used, and for 'na-' class nouns nawu.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Red flowered kurrajong. The seeds are edible and the bark is used to make string and fibre.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Scientific nameBrachychiton paradoxum

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Manbu mandjabu korroko dabborrabbolk birrimangi kunyarl kore manbornde mandedjmad kunyarl dja kore kundulk manbudbud kunyarl.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            In the old days, people used banyan root fibres and kurrajong bark fibres to make string for fish traps.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            (Andrew Manakgu, Injalak Arts painting documentation.)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          LanguageKuninjku, Kune, Kunwinjku

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Aquatic grass-like herb, with small edible reddish tuber. Extracted from clayish soils by hand and with digging sticks by women. The many small tubers are washed and roasted lightly before eating. They have a crunchy texture when eaten.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Scientific nameTriglochin dubia

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Manwern manbu manme ngarriburrbun manwern manme manbu minj ngarrikukngun yiman karrbarda mankinjdjek mankodjbang manbuled mankongkong dja manwern manbu minj ngarrikukngun. Manwern manme ngarriwilkdeng. Badjdjo dja mankurladj makka ngarrikukngun.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            We know lots of types of vegetables, there are lots of vegetables which we don’t eat raw, like long yams, cheeky yams, water peanuts, Triglochin dubia and bush potatoes. We cook lots of vegetables in hot coals. Brachystelma glabriflorum and spike rush corms are two vegetable foods which we eat raw.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            (Andrew Manakgu, Injalak Arts painting documentation)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          LanguageKunwinjku

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Type of water lily corms which feature in the public version of the Orphan or “Crying Boy” Dreaming story at Kabbari. The boy is said to have cried so unceasingly for manburrangkali that the Rainbow Serpent heard him, rose up and swallowed him.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Manburrangkali kakukrohrok mandem dja ngalengman kadjordmen kore kukabo kore kuwarddewardde. Minj kadjordmen kore kabbal dja manlabbarl.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Manburrangkali lilies look similar to regular waterlilies, but they grow in rivers up in escarpment country. They don't grow on floodplains and in billabongs.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            (Jill Nganjmirra)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Kunkare kohbakohbanj birrihyolyolmi nakudji wurdyaw nalkbuhnalkbuni, ngalyod binguneng. Birrikaybom manburrangkali, manmekbe manu manjbekkang manmanjmak duninj.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            The old people would tell us a story that a long time ago a boy cried and cried, and the Rainbow Serpent ate him. They had refused to give him more manburrangkali [lily corms], which he had tasted and found to have a wonderful flavour.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            (Maralngurra, Dolly, ‘Nakudji Namarladj Ngiwkmihngiwkmirey’, Oenpelli Literature Production Centre, 1974)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Cloth, fabric, men's ceremonial loin cloth.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Synonymskorrh

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Manburrba yima yidukkarren yiborrkkemen.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Get a loin cloth, tie it up on yourself and dance.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Kunbalakkorrh

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Slightly woody vine climbing high in surrounding trees; very closely related to Ipomea abrupta. The leaves are narrow to broadly ovate or triangular, blade 50-150 mm long x 15-120 mm wide, sometimes with rounded spear shaped lobes at the base, petiole 25-75 mm long. The flowers are funnel-shaped, mauve to purple with darker throat, petals 65 mm to 85 mm long.The fruit is a globular capsule, 10-14 mm diameter with 4 black seeds to 7 mm long covered in long dense sinuous white to pale brown hairs to 4 mm long. The tubers or 'yams' are roasted on coals before being eaten. The name may also be applied to Stephania japonica and Decaschistia byrnesii.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Synonymsan-yong

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Scientific nameIpomoea dunlopii

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • An-burre makka an-kimuk, makka an-yayawno, bininjken. Barrk ngaleng kaworrngun, djukerre ka-worrngun.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Ipomoea dunlopii is much bigger but this one I'm talking about, something people can eat, is much smaller. an-burre is for humans but the black wallaroo would eat the leaves of it.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • An-warddewaken, bad mimih ke ka-ngun, ka-ngun ngalekke mimih, an-yong, ngan-burre, nguddah, bulanj, yi-ngeybun, karri-ngeybun mah ngan-burre.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            It grows in the rock country but mimih eat it, those mimih (women) eat it, that bush radish tuber, Bulanj, you eastern people call it ngan-burre [manburre], well we all call it that.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Dja bu bolkkime nawu daluhdaluk yawkyawk minj kabirriburrbun manbu manme kabirringeybun mahni mankongkong manburre mankodjbang manbuled mankinjdjek, larrk mankudji karrbarda kabirribengkan.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            But these days most women and girls don't know about mankongkong (Ipomoea graminea), manburre (Ipomoea dunlopii), mankodjbang (Aponogeton elongatus), manbuled (Triglochin dubia) or mankinjdjek (Dioscorea bulbifera). They only know about long yams, that's it.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            (Bardayal Nadjamerrek)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          LanguageKunwinjku, Kuninjku, Kune

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Milky plum tree.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Scientific namePersoonia falcata

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Manbalmed dja mandak yirrong yimarnbun yingun karrirawon.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Pound the Planchonella arnhemica and the Persoonia falcata fruit together and you can eat it.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          LanguageKuninjku,Kunwinjku

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Kind of herbaceous plant of the Arum family (as are Amorphophallus spp.) with a subterranean corm which has toxins in it that must be processed before the tuber is rendered edible. The leaves and stem are removed and the corm roasted in hot coals. It is then pounded with a stone for a long time to get the juice out, washed with water and pounded again. The corm pulp must turn from white to a black colour before it is edible. Arum plants belong to the yarriburrik matry which has fire as its totemic emblem, most likely because fire is involved in the preparation of the tubers.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Synonymskubulurr

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Scientific nameTyphonium cochlear, Typhonium flagelliforme, Typhonium russell-smithii

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Kohbahkohbanj bindibukkani yawkyawk birrikarungi mankongkong, karrbarrda, mandanek.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            The old people would show the girls how to dig up bush potatoes, long yams and arum roots.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            (Quoted in Etherington, Steve, ‘Learning to be Kunwinjku: Kunwinjku people discuss their pedagogy’, PhD Thesis, Charles Darwin University, 2006)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          LanguageKundedjnjenghmi, Kunwinjku

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Distal end of a didjeridu.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Mani mandangkimuk manmelkmakkayken.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            This one [didjeridu] has a wide mouth at the distal end and it has an excellent tone.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          LanguageKunwinjku,Kundjeyhmi
